entries.title: Female prisoners threatened with extra jail time if they use 'wrong' pronoun for trans inmates
entries.description:
Prisoners convicted of crimes can have their sentence extended depending on how they behave. Fighting will get you a demerit. Killing one of the other inmates is still considered murder so that's a no-no. And in England, if you are a female inmate and you misgender a trans inmate, that too could get time ADDED to your sentence.

So, congratulations to the UK. Arresting someone for praying is no longer the dumbest thing we've heard you do in the name of "justice." It's only tied.

According to The Telegraph, a Justice Minister says women prisoners who call trans inmates by the wrong pronoun could face extra time in jail under "equality rules." Only women prisoners, though. Not unlike when it comes to competing in high school and college sports, you don't hear a lot of biological women who identify as men fighting for their right to be imprisoned with biological men.

Nuts to the women, though. If a man says he's a woman and is convicted of committing a crime, the criminal can request to be incarcerated with women who have always been women.

Female inmates who deliberately call a transgender woman “he” or “him” could be punished under rules barring “threatening, abusive or insulting words or behaviour”.

“Incidents where a prisoner uses incorrect pronouns for another prisoner will be considered on a case-by-case basis, in line with the prisoner discipline procedures policy and the prison rules.

Lord Wolfson, the justice minister, said it will be handled on a case-by-case basis. If you accidentally call a she a he because they used to be a he before they decided they were she, they'll go easy on you. But if an "independent adjudicator" determines you misgendered in malice, there will be consequences.

Potentially, that includes having your sentence extended. Over calling someone the "wrong" thing. Calling someone the wrong name gets you jail time in England. Worse, there are leftists in America who don't see a problem with that depending on what they determine the "wrong" thing to be.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Joe Biden claims 'MAGA sympathizing' secret service agents lied about his dog biting them: Report
entries.description:
One of our favorite stories from early on in Joe Biden's presidency, long before we only assumed he'd be a disaster and didn't have it confirmed, was his dog Major Biden having a biting problem. It's being reported in a new book that Biden called the secret service agents who claimed to have been bitten by his dog lying liars who lied.

You had to assume there would be controversy over someone biting the help in the White House. But I think most people assumed it would be Joe Biden doing the biting and not Major Biden. The two were similar. Joe Biden has exhibited anger issues and lashed out at people in the past. Major has been known to, per an in-depth report from CNN, "display agitated behavior on multiple occasions, including jumping, barking, and 'charging' staff and security." Also similar to Joe Biden. Just replace "staff and security" with little girls who smell nice.

Now, according to Chris Whipple's new book The Fight of His Life: Inside Joe Biden's White House, Biden said someone was lying about Major Biden biting secret service agents eight days in a row.

While he did not go so far as to claim the bite never happened, the president apparently did not accept the story that the agent was bitten on the second floor of the executive mansion.
"Look, the Secret Service are never up here. It didn’t happen," Biden reportedly said to a friend.

Part of the problem, per the book, was the paranoid distrust POTUS had for his secret service agents. The agency was, according to Biden, full of too many white ex-cops from the south who Biden racially profiled as "MAGA sympathizers."

Major is no longer a part of Biden's family. When they adopted Commander, a younger puppy, the Biden Family claimed experts told them it would be safer for Major "to live in a quieter environment with family and friends." Though those experts did not specify who it would be safer for.

entries.title: Watch: UFC star invites internet troll to man up in the cage, proceeds to destroy him
entries.description:
Anyone who has dealt with an internet troll has wanted to do this. Sure, hashtag #imrubberyourglue is the ideal way to go. But it doesn't always bounce off of me and stick to you. In the movies, you could do what Jay and Silent Bob did. Buy a bunch of plane tickets, confront twelve-year-olds roided up on internet muscles from the safety of their mother's basement, and beat the crap out of them. If it's the real world and you are UFC star Paddy the Baddy, you invite the guy to say it to your face. And offer him $602.50 for his troubles.

(He ackshually offered it in British money, but since none of you care about British money I did the conversion)

To the troll's credit, he showed up. To Paddy's credit, he held back. A lot. And still kicked the wanker's arse.

UFC Vs Troll - Paddy the Baddy fights an internet troll IRL! youtu.be

He'll get a little lesson, but I am only going to play with him. ... This is how we deal with trolls.

I should point out that the $602.50 was only if the troll didn't quit. The troll quit after two rounds, saying "I feel like I should probably go to the hospital" before apologizing for being a troll. Paddy still gave him $60.25 to get a bite to eat and a pint or two.

The troll got off easy. MMA fighter Jake Shields confronted his internet troll a few weeks ago and beat the sh*t out of the guy. This was more done in good, clean fun. And most importantly, done for the content.

No word on Paddy the Baddy's next fight, but Matt "Steamrolla" Frevola has been mentioned. I'm a fan of Paddy's, but Frevola is from Strong Island so The Baddy is gonna need to get slept.

entries.title: 'Echoes of the previous night's mental breakdown': Vlogger takes us for a walk through the hell hole known as San Francisco
entries.description:
Videos like this need to be amplified. While it may be too late for our cities, the rest of America needs to be warned. The progressive politicians who have turned San Francisco and other progressive cities into these hellholes with their progressive policies will do the same to your neighborhood if elected.

Let's take another stroll through Nancy Pelosistan:

Nancy Pelosi’s district is a hell hole 👇🏻 pic.twitter.com/xki6RhDwNy
— Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok) December 30, 2022

Shout out to my man for switching up the readback voice. He sounds more like Sam Elliot and less like Rosie the Robot.

"Walk with me through lovely San Francisco. This is not an anomaly. This is practically every flat street near public transportation. Stolen bikes and echoes of the previous night's mental breakdown are omnipresent."

And a mannequin for some reason.

"These homeless are almost all drug addicts, most of them unpredictable, posing a serious threat to children/elderly and women."

The narrator then claims it is empathy that keeps San Francisco and our "once great cities" like this when tough love is needed. I have no idea what gives him that idea.

Wow… this is what kids in San Francisco have to walk through to get home from school… watch till end pic.twitter.com/zMdsC16Jlf
— Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok) July 9, 2022

No idea at all.

On my evening walk. SOMA isn’t safe. Just happened. This is disgusting @MattHaneySF. I’ve written to your office and you and failed to take action. Why??? Is it worth your time? pic.twitter.com/cLwAtb4ZGU
— J. (@jterrell) September 9, 2022

Maybe this guy knows,

People say lack of housing forces local residents into the streets, but James says he came from Texas to San Francisco for the drugs, the non-enforcement of anti-camping laws, and the $820/month in welfare & food stamps. James says he sold fentanyl, 2 weeks ago, to a 15-year-old. pic.twitter.com/5qMr6tmlWs
— Michael Shellenberger (@ShellenbergerMD) February 9, 2022

You would think visuals like this that have been going on for decades would be a major news story. But as we see with Joe Biden's border crisis and the crime waves in progressive cities throughout America, corporate media doesn't care unless they have a Republican to blame. There hasn't been a Republican mayor in San Francisco since 1964.

What you see are the results of half a century of progressivism. Coming soon to a street near you if you let it.

entries.title: Suspect in Times Square 'Jihadist' attack was - you guessed it - known by the FBI
entries.description:
Trevor Bickford, a Maine man, is the suspect accused of slashing two New York City Police officers in Times Square with a machete. Bickford recently converted to Islam and may have ties to Islamic Extremism. His motive was unknown.

One thing, or person, who was known is Trevor Bickford. According to Fox News, Bickford was...wait for it...

"A high-level police source also tells Fox News Digital that Bickford was being watched by the FBI's counterterrorism task force in the weeks leading up to Saturday's attack. The source also said Bickford recently converted to Islam."

This is the weapon that was recovered at the scene. https://t.co/Waaux2hUTt pic.twitter.com/EijU7QUgkQ
— NYPD NEWS (@NYPDnews) January 1, 2023

At a press conference, FBI's Michael Driscoll said that "the FBI, through the Joint Terrorism Task Force, is working very closely with [NYPD] to determine the nature of this attack" and "we will run every lead to ground." They may want to start with Bickford's note in his back pocket.

Bickford, who allegedly told investigators he went to Times Square looking to attack police officers or "someone with a gun," had a copy of his handwritten "manifesto" on him according to the New York Post. In the note, Bickford feared his mother would not repent to Allah. He called on his brother to repent to Alalh and accused his other brother of "joining the ranks of my enemy" by becoming a Marine.

Again, Bickford's motive for attacking two police officers -- both of whom expected to make full recoveries -- are unknown. But the FBI is running every lead into the ground.

2022 was not a good year for instilling trust and confidence in the FBI as an institution. The release of the "Twitter Files' shows they had an abnormal interest in what random people were tweeting. Other things, such as investigating child sexual abuse cases, took a back seat.
